Overview.Definition: MySQL is an open-source relational database management system.
Overview.Features: Supports SQL queries, ACID compliance, and is widely used for web applications.

Installation.Platforms: Available for Windows, macOS, and Linux.

Basic Commands.Download: Download from the official MySQL website.
Basic Commands.Start Server: Run 'mysql.server start' or use system services.

Creating a Table.Syntax: CREATE TABLE table_name (column1 datatype, column2 datatype);
Creating a Table.Example: CREATE TABLE users (id INT AUTO_INCREMENT PRIMARY KEY, name VARCHAR(255));

Inserting Data.Syntax: INSERT INTO table_name (column1, column2) VALUES (value1, value2);

Where Clause.Syntax: SELECT column1 FROM table_name WHERE condition;
Where Clause.Example: SELECT * FROM users WHERE name = 'John Doe';

Joins.Definition: Combine rows from two or more tables based on related columns.

Example.Inner Join: SELECT * FROM users INNER JOIN orders ON users.id = orders.user_id;

Updating Data.Syntax: UPDATE table_name SET column1 = value1 WHERE condition;
Updating Data.Example: UPDATE users SET name = 'Jane Doe' WHERE id = 1;

Indexes.Using Indexes: Improves query performance by speeding up data retrieval.

Transactions.Definition: A sequence of operations performed as a single logical unit.

Stored Procedures.Definition: A set of SQL statements that can be stored and reused.

Creating a Procedure.Syntax: CREATE PROCEDURE procedure_name (parameters) BEGIN SQL statements; END;
Creating a Procedure.Example: CREATE PROCEDURE GetUsers() BEGIN SELECT * FROM users; END;

Triggers.Definition: A set of instructions that are automatically executed in response to certain events.

Creating a Trigger.Syntax: CREATE TRIGGER trigger_name BEFORE/AFTER INSERT/UPDATE/DELETE ON table_name FOR EACH ROW BEGIN SQL statements; END;

Views.Definition: A virtual table based on the result of a SELECT query.

Creating a View.Syntax: CREATE VIEW view_name AS SELECT column1, column2 FROM table_name;

Replication.Definition: The process of copying and maintaining database objects in multiple databases.

Types.Master-Slave: One master database replicates to one or more slave databases.
Types.Master-Master: Two or more databases act as both master and slave.

Optimization.Indexing: Using indexes to speed up queries.
Optimization.Query Optimization: Analyzing and improving query performance using EXPLAIN.
